::: {.about-intro-card}
## About Me

Hi, I'm **Zain**, a third-year **Applied Statistics** student at the **University of Toronto Mississauga**, with minors in **Computer Science** and **Mathematics**.  

I'm passionate about connecting **data, design, and storytelling** by using analysis and visualization to make information more human and useful.
:::

::: {.about-section-card}
### Current Work

I'm currently a **Software Engineer Intern** at **Wholeviz**, a data visualization platform helping NGOs, journalists, and public teams turn datasets into interactive dashboards. My work focuses on **React**, **Next.js**, **Tailwind**, and **Plotly**, where I design intuitive front-end interfaces and experiment with **AI-assisted data visualization** features.

Recently, I was selected for the **Skills for the Future Program** with **IBM SkillsBuild × Riipen**, collaborating with **Digital Placemaking Canada** on website redesign and data-driven dashboards.

My startup experience has taught me to be adaptable, communicate effectively across different teams, and deliver results in fast-paced environments.
:::

::: {.about-section-card}
### More About Me

Alongside my work, I'm completing the **IBM Data Analytics Professional Certificate** on Coursera and the **IBM SkillsBuild Digital Credential in User Experience Design Fundamentals**. Through these programs, I'm deepening my skills in **Excel, SQL, Python (Pandas)**, and **IBM Cognos Analytics**, while learning to bridge **analytical storytelling** with **UI and UX design thinking**.

Outside of code and coursework, I recharge through **volleyball**, **table tennis**, and long walks around Mississauga. I'm naturally curious about how things work, whether that's a dataset, a business model, or a React component, and I like turning that curiosity into projects that make data actually mean something.

**Get in touch:** [zain.ghias@mail.utoronto.ca](mailto:zain.ghias@mail.utoronto.ca)
:::

::: {.callout-tip title="Currently Open to Summer 2026 Internships"}
Looking for opportunities in **Data Analytics**, **Business Analysis**, **Frontend / UI-UX Development**, or **Software Engineering / Data Visualization**.  
Open to roles focused on **analytics**, **design**, and **problem-solving**.
:::


## Featured Project: Toronto Bike Share Analysis

::: {.callout-note style="max-width: 430px;"}
### Toronto Bike Share – March 2023 vs March 2024

![](projects/bikeshare/images/Bike_Share_Toronto_logo.png){width="200px" .center}

Analyzing **Bike Share Toronto** data to uncover how ridership patterns evolved year over year and whether network growth aligned with actual demand.  

**Stack:** Excel · Tableau · Python (planned)  

**Key Question:** Are Bike Share Toronto’s growing assets being used efficiently, or are certain stations and times under-utilized?  

[View Project](projects/bikeshare/index.qmd){.btn .btn-primary .me-2}

<script>
// Scroll-triggered left border animation for about cards and project cards
(function() {
  'use strict';
  
  if (!('IntersectionObserver' in window)) {
    document.querySelectorAll('.about-intro-card, .about-section-card, .experience-card, .about-contents .callout-note').forEach(function(card) {
      card.classList.add('border-animated');
    });
    return;
  }
  
  const borderObserver = new IntersectionObserver(function(entries) {
    entries.forEach(function(entry) {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        entry.target.classList.add('border-animated');
        borderObserver.unobserve(entry.target);
      }
    });
  }, {
    threshold: 0.4,
    rootMargin: '0px 0px -100px 0px'
  });
  
  document.querySelectorAll('.about-intro-card, .about-section-card, .experience-card, .about-contents .callout-note').forEach(function(card) {
    borderObserver.observe(card);
  });
})();

// Scroll-triggered progress bar animation
(function() {
  'use strict';
  
  if (!('IntersectionObserver' in window)) {
    document.querySelectorAll('.progress-bar').forEach(function(bar) {
      const progress = bar.getAttribute('data-progress');
      if (progress) {
        setTimeout(function() {
          bar.style.width = progress + '%';
        }, 100);
      }
    });
    return;
  }
  
  const progressObserver = new IntersectionObserver(function(entries) {
    entries.forEach(function(entry) {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        const bar = entry.target;
        const progress = bar.getAttribute('data-progress');
        
        if (progress && !bar.classList.contains('animated')) {
          bar.classList.add('animated');
          setTimeout(function() {
            bar.style.width = progress + '%';
          }, 100);
        }
        
        progressObserver.unobserve(bar);
      }
    });
  }, {
    threshold: 0.3,
    rootMargin: '0px 0px -50px 0px'
  });
  
  document.querySelectorAll('.progress-bar').forEach(function(bar) {
    progressObserver.observe(bar);
  });
  
  const kpiObserver = new IntersectionObserver(function(entries) {
    entries.forEach(function(entry) {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        entry.target.style.opacity = '1';
        entry.target.style.transform = 'translateY(0)';
        kpiObserver.unobserve(entry.target);
      }
    });
  }, {
    threshold: 0.2,
    rootMargin: '0px 0px -30px 0px'
  });
  
  document.querySelectorAll('.kpi-card').forEach(function(card, index) {
    card.style.opacity = '0';
    card.style.transform = 'translateY(20px)';
    card.style.transition = 'opacity 0.5s cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94) ' + (index * 0.1) + 's, transform 0.5s cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94) ' + (index * 0.1) + 's';
    kpiObserver.observe(card);
  });
})();
</script>
